2233 def test_sort_order(self):
2234 # Test sorting an array with fields
2235 x1 = np.array([21, 32, 14])
2236 x2 = np.array(['my', 'first', 'name'])
2237 x3 = np.array([3.1, 4.5, 6.2])
2238 r = np.rec.fromarrays([x1, x2, x3], names='id,word,number')
2239  
2240 r.sort(order=['id'])
2241 assert_equal(r.id, np.array([14, 21, 32]))
2242 assert_equal(r.word, np.array(['name', 'my', 'first']))
2243 assert_equal(r.number, np.array([6.2, 3.1, 4.5]))
2244  
2245 r.sort(order=['word'])
2246 assert_equal(r.id, np.array([32, 21, 14]))
2247 assert_equal(r.word, np.array(['first', 'my', 'name']))
2248 assert_equal(r.number, np.array([4.5, 3.1, 6.2]))
2249  
2250 r.sort(order=['number'])
2251 assert_equal(r.id, np.array([21, 32, 14]))
2252 assert_equal(r.word, np.array(['my', 'first', 'name']))
2253 assert_equal(r.number, np.array([3.1, 4.5, 6.2]))
2254  
2255 assert_raises_regex(ValueError, 'duplicate',
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
2256 lambda: r.sort(order=['id', 'id']))
2257  
2258 if sys.byteorder == 'little':
2259 strtype = '>i2'
2260 else:
2261 strtype = '<i2'
2262 mydtype = [('name', 'U5'), ('col2', strtype)]
2263 r = np.array([('a', 1), ('b', 255), ('c', 3), ('d', 258)],
2264 dtype=mydtype)
2265 r.sort(order='col2')
2266 assert_equal(r['col2'], [1, 3, 255, 258])
2267 assert_equal(r, np.array([('a', 1), ('c', 3), ('b', 255), ('d', 258)],
2268 dtype=mydtype))
2269  
2270 def test_argsort(self):
2271 # all c scalar argsorts use the same code with different types
2272 # so it suffices to run a quick check with one type. The number
2273 # of sorted items must be greater than ~50 to check the actual
2274 # algorithm because quick and merge sort fall over to insertion
2275 # sort for small arrays.
2276  
2277 for dtype in [np.int32, np.uint32, np.float32]:
2278 a = np.arange(101, dtype=dtype)
2279 b = a[::-1].copy()
2280 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2281 msg = "scalar argsort, kind=%s, dtype=%s" % (kind, dtype)
2282 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), a, msg)
2283 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), b, msg)
2284  
2285 # test complex argsorts. These use the same code as the scalars
2286 # but the compare function differs.
2287 ai = a*1j + 1
2288 bi = b*1j + 1
2289 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2290 msg = "complex argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2291 assert_equal(ai.copy().argsort(kind=kind), a, msg)
2292 assert_equal(bi.copy().argsort(kind=kind), b, msg)
2293 ai = a + 1j
2294 bi = b + 1j
2295 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2296 msg = "complex argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2297 assert_equal(ai.copy().argsort(kind=kind), a, msg)
2298 assert_equal(bi.copy().argsort(kind=kind), b, msg)
2299  
2300 # test argsort of complex arrays requiring byte-swapping, gh-5441
2301 for endianness in '<>':
2302 for dt in np.typecodes['Complex']:
2303 arr = np.array([1+3.j, 2+2.j, 3+1.j], dtype=endianness + dt)
2304 msg = 'byte-swapped complex argsort, dtype={0}'.format(dt)
2305 assert_equal(arr.argsort(),
2306 np.arange(len(arr), dtype=np.intp), msg)
2307  
2308 # test string argsorts.
2309 s = 'aaaaaaaa'
2310 a = np.array([s + chr(i) for i in range(101)])
2311 b = a[::-1].copy()
2312 r = np.arange(101)
2313 rr = r[::-1]
2314 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2315 msg = "string argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2316 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2317 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2318  
2319 # test unicode argsorts.
2320 s = 'aaaaaaaa'
2321 a = np.array([s + chr(i) for i in range(101)], dtype=np.unicode_)
2322 b = a[::-1]
2323 r = np.arange(101)
2324 rr = r[::-1]
2325 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2326 msg = "unicode argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2327 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2328 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2329  
2330 # test object array argsorts.
2331 a = np.empty((101,), dtype=object)
2332 a[:] = list(range(101))
2333 b = a[::-1]
2334 r = np.arange(101)
2335 rr = r[::-1]
2336 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2337 msg = "object argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2338 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2339 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2340  
2341 # test structured array argsorts.
2342 dt = np.dtype([('f', float), ('i', int)])
2343 a = np.array([(i, i) for i in range(101)], dtype=dt)
2344 b = a[::-1]
2345 r = np.arange(101)
2346 rr = r[::-1]
2347 for kind in self.sort_kinds:
2348 msg = "structured array argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2349 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2350 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2351  
2352 # test datetime64 argsorts.
2353 a = np.arange(0, 101, dtype='datetime64[D]')
2354 b = a[::-1]
2355 r = np.arange(101)
2356 rr = r[::-1]
2357 for kind in ['q', 'h', 'm']:
2358 msg = "datetime64 argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2359 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2360 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2361  
2362 # test timedelta64 argsorts.
2363 a = np.arange(0, 101, dtype='timedelta64[D]')
2364 b = a[::-1]
2365 r = np.arange(101)
2366 rr = r[::-1]
2367 for kind in ['q', 'h', 'm']:
2368 msg = "timedelta64 argsort, kind=%s" % kind
2369 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(kind=kind), r, msg)
2370 assert_equal(b.copy().argsort(kind=kind), rr, msg)
2371  
2372 # check axis handling. This should be the same for all type
2373 # specific argsorts, so we only check it for one type and one kind
2374 a = np.array([[3, 2], [1, 0]])
2375 b = np.array([[1, 1], [0, 0]])
2376 c = np.array([[1, 0], [1, 0]])
2377 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(axis=0), b)
2378 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(axis=1), c)
2379 assert_equal(a.copy().argsort(), c)
2380  
2381 # check axis handling for multidimensional empty arrays
2382 a = np.array([])
2383 a.shape = (3, 2, 1, 0)
2384 for axis in range(-a.ndim, a.ndim):
2385 msg = 'test empty array argsort with axis={0}'.format(axis)
2386 assert_equal(np.argsort(a, axis=axis),
2387 np.zeros_like(a, dtype=np.intp), msg)
2388 msg = 'test empty array argsort with axis=None'
2389 assert_equal(np.argsort(a, axis=None),
2390 np.zeros_like(a.ravel(), dtype=np.intp), msg)
2391  
2392 # check that stable argsorts are stable
2393 r = np.arange(100)
2394 # scalars
2395 a = np.zeros(100)
2396 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2397 # complex
2398 a = np.zeros(100, dtype=complex)
2399 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2400 # string
2401 a = np.array(['aaaaaaaaa' for i in range(100)])
2402 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2403 # unicode
2404 a = np.array(['aaaaaaaaa' for i in range(100)], dtype=np.unicode_)
2405 assert_equal(a.argsort(kind='m'), r)
2406  
2407 def test_sort_unicode_kind(self):
2408 d = np.arange(10)
2409 k = b'\xc3\xa4'.decode("UTF8")
2410 assert_raises(ValueError, d.sort, kind=k)
2411 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argsort, kind=k)
2412  
2413 @pytest.mark.parametrize('a', [
2414 np.array([0, 1, np.nan], dtype=np.float16),
2415 np.array([0, 1, np.nan], dtype=np.float32),
2416 np.array([0, 1, np.nan]),
2417 ])
2418 def test_searchsorted_floats(self, a):
  • W291 Trailing whitespace
2419 # test for floats arrays containing nans. Explicitly test
2420 # half, single, and double precision floats to verify that
2421 # the NaN-handling is correct.
2422 msg = "Test real (%s) searchsorted with nans, side='l'" % a.dtype
2423 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='left')
2424 assert_equal(b, np.arange(3), msg)
2425 msg = "Test real (%s) searchsorted with nans, side='r'" % a.dtype
2426 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='right')
2427 assert_equal(b, np.arange(1, 4), msg)
2428 # check keyword arguments
2429 a.searchsorted(v=1)
2430 x = np.array([0, 1, np.nan], dtype='float32')
2431 y = np.searchsorted(x, x[-1])
2432 assert_equal(y, 2)
2433  
2434 def test_searchsorted_complex(self):
  • W291 Trailing whitespace
2435 # test for complex arrays containing nans.
2436 # The search sorted routines use the compare functions for the
2437 # array type, so this checks if that is consistent with the sort
2438 # order.
2439 # check double complex
2440 a = np.zeros(9, dtype=np.complex128)
2441 a.real += [0, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, np.nan, np.nan, np.nan]
2442 a.imag += [0, 1, 0, 1, np.nan, np.nan, 0, 1, np.nan]
2443 msg = "Test complex searchsorted with nans, side='l'"
2444 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='left')
2445 assert_equal(b, np.arange(9), msg)
2446 msg = "Test complex searchsorted with nans, side='r'"
2447 b = a.searchsorted(a, side='right')
2448 assert_equal(b, np.arange(1, 10), msg)
2449 msg = "Test searchsorted with little endian, side='l'"
2450 a = np.array([0, 128], dtype='<i4')
2451 b = a.searchsorted(np.array(128, dtype='<i4'))
2452 assert_equal(b, 1, msg)
2453 msg = "Test searchsorted with big endian, side='l'"
2454 a = np.array([0, 128], dtype='>i4')
2455 b = a.searchsorted(np.array(128, dtype='>i4'))
2456 assert_equal(b, 1, msg)
  • W293 Blank line contains whitespace
2457
2458 def test_searchsorted_n_elements(self):
2459 # Check 0 elements
2460 a = np.ones(0)
2461 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'left')
2462 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 0])
2463 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'right')
2464 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 0])
2465 a = np.ones(1)
2466 # Check 1 element
2467 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'left')
2468 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 1])
2469 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'right')
2470 assert_equal(b, [0, 1, 1])
2471 # Check all elements equal
2472 a = np.ones(2)
2473 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'left')
2474 assert_equal(b, [0, 0, 2])
2475 b = a.searchsorted([0, 1, 2], 'right')
2476 assert_equal(b, [0, 2, 2])
2477  
2478 def test_searchsorted_unaligned_array(self):
2479 # Test searching unaligned array
2480 a = np.arange(10)
2481 aligned = np.empty(a.itemsize * a.size + 1, 'uint8')
2482 unaligned = aligned[1:].view(a.dtype)
2483 unaligned[:] = a
2484 # Test searching unaligned array
2485 b = unaligned.searchsorted(a, 'left')
2486 assert_equal(b, a)
2487 b = unaligned.searchsorted(a, 'right')
2488 assert_equal(b, a + 1)
2489 # Test searching for unaligned keys
2490 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'left')
2491 assert_equal(b, a)
2492 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'right')
2493 assert_equal(b, a + 1)
2494  
2495 def test_searchsorted_resetting(self):
2496 # Test smart resetting of binsearch indices
2497 a = np.arange(5)
2498 b = a.searchsorted([6, 5, 4], 'left')
2499 assert_equal(b, [5, 5, 4])
2500 b = a.searchsorted([6, 5, 4], 'right')
2501 assert_equal(b, [5, 5, 5])
2502  
2503 def test_searchsorted_type_specific(self):
2504 # Test all type specific binary search functions
2505 types = ''.join((np.typecodes['AllInteger'], np.typecodes['AllFloat'],
2506 np.typecodes['Datetime'], '?O'))
2507 for dt in types:
2508 if dt == 'M':
2509 dt = 'M8[D]'
2510 if dt == '?':
2511 a = np.arange(2, dtype=dt)
2512 out = np.arange(2)
2513 else:
2514 a = np.arange(0, 5, dtype=dt)
2515 out = np.arange(5)
2516 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'left')
2517 assert_equal(b, out)
2518 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'right')
2519 assert_equal(b, out + 1)
2520 # Test empty array, use a fresh array to get warnings in
2521 # valgrind if access happens.
2522 e = np.ndarray(shape=0, buffer=b'', dtype=dt)
2523 b = e.searchsorted(a, 'left')
2524 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(len(a), dtype=np.intp))
2525 b = a.searchsorted(e, 'left')
2526 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(0, dtype=np.intp))
2527  
2528 def test_searchsorted_unicode(self):
2529 # Test searchsorted on unicode strings.
2530  
2531 # 1.6.1 contained a string length miscalculation in
2532 # arraytypes.c.src:UNICODE_compare() which manifested as
2533 # incorrect/inconsistent results from searchsorted.
2534 a = np.array(['P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100185_1',
2535 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100186_1',
2536 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100187_1',
2537 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100189_1',
2538 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100190_1',
2539 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100191_1',
2540 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100192_1',
2541 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100193_1',
2542 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100194_1',
2543 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100195_1',
2544 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100196_1',
2545 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100197_1',
2546 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100198_1',
2547 'P:\\20x_dapi_cy3\\20x_dapi_cy3_20100199_1'],
2548 dtype=np.unicode_)
2549 ind = np.arange(len(a))
2550 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(v, 'left') for v in a], ind)
2551 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(v, 'right') for v in a], ind + 1)
2552 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(a[i], 'left') for i in ind], ind)
2553 assert_equal([a.searchsorted(a[i], 'right') for i in ind], ind + 1)
2554  
2555 def test_searchsorted_with_invalid_sorter(self):
2556 a = np.array([5, 2, 1, 3, 4])
  • F841 Local variable 's' is assigned to but never used
2557 s = np.argsort(a)
2558 assert_raises(TypeError, np.searchsorted, a, 0,
2559 sorter=np.array((1, (2, 3)), dtype=object))
2560 assert_raises(TypeError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[1.1])
2561 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[1, 2, 3, 4])
2562 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6])
2563  
2564 # bounds check
2565 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 4, sorter=[0, 1, 2, 3, 5])
2566 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[-1, 0, 1, 2, 3])
2567 assert_raises(ValueError, np.searchsorted, a, 0, sorter=[4, 0, -1, 2, 3])
2568  
2569 def test_searchsorted_with_sorter(self):
2570 a = np.random.rand(300)
2571 s = a.argsort()
2572 b = np.sort(a)
2573 k = np.linspace(0, 1, 20)
2574 assert_equal(b.searchsorted(k), a.searchsorted(k, sorter=s))
2575  
2576 a = np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 5]*20)
2577 s = a.argsort()
2578 k = [0, 1, 2, 3, 5]
2579 expected = [0, 20, 40, 60, 80]
2580 assert_equal(a.searchsorted(k, side='left', sorter=s), expected)
2581 expected = [20, 40, 60, 80, 100]
2582 assert_equal(a.searchsorted(k, side='right', sorter=s), expected)
2583  
2584 # Test searching unaligned array
2585 keys = np.arange(10)
2586 a = keys.copy()
2587 np.random.shuffle(s)
2588 s = a.argsort()
2589 aligned = np.empty(a.itemsize * a.size + 1, 'uint8')
2590 unaligned = aligned[1:].view(a.dtype)
2591 # Test searching unaligned array
2592 unaligned[:] = a
2593 b = unaligned.searchsorted(keys, 'left', s)
2594 assert_equal(b, keys)
2595 b = unaligned.searchsorted(keys, 'right', s)
2596 assert_equal(b, keys + 1)
2597 # Test searching for unaligned keys
2598 unaligned[:] = keys
2599 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'left', s)
2600 assert_equal(b, keys)
2601 b = a.searchsorted(unaligned, 'right', s)
2602 assert_equal(b, keys + 1)
2603  
2604 # Test all type specific indirect binary search functions
2605 types = ''.join((np.typecodes['AllInteger'], np.typecodes['AllFloat'],
2606 np.typecodes['Datetime'], '?O'))
2607 for dt in types:
2608 if dt == 'M':
2609 dt = 'M8[D]'
2610 if dt == '?':
2611 a = np.array([1, 0], dtype=dt)
2612 # We want the sorter array to be of a type that is different
2613 # from np.intp in all platforms, to check for #4698
2614 s = np.array([1, 0], dtype=np.int16)
2615 out = np.array([1, 0])
2616 else:
2617 a = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0], dtype=dt)
2618 # We want the sorter array to be of a type that is different
2619 # from np.intp in all platforms, to check for #4698
2620 s = np.array([4, 2, 3, 0, 1], dtype=np.int16)
2621 out = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0], dtype=np.intp)
2622 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'left', s)
2623 assert_equal(b, out)
2624 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'right', s)
2625 assert_equal(b, out + 1)
2626 # Test empty array, use a fresh array to get warnings in
2627 # valgrind if access happens.
2628 e = np.ndarray(shape=0, buffer=b'', dtype=dt)
2629 b = e.searchsorted(a, 'left', s[:0])
2630 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(len(a), dtype=np.intp))
2631 b = a.searchsorted(e, 'left', s)
2632 assert_array_equal(b, np.zeros(0, dtype=np.intp))
2633  
2634 # Test non-contiguous sorter array
2635 a = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0])
2636 srt = np.empty((10,), dtype=np.intp)
2637 srt[1::2] = -1
2638 srt[::2] = [4, 2, 3, 0, 1]
2639 s = srt[::2]
2640 out = np.array([3, 4, 1, 2, 0], dtype=np.intp)
2641 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'left', s)
2642 assert_equal(b, out)
2643 b = a.searchsorted(a, 'right', s)
2644 assert_equal(b, out + 1)
2645  
2646 def test_searchsorted_return_type(self):
2647 # Functions returning indices should always return base ndarrays
2648 class A(np.ndarray):
2649 pass
2650 a = np.arange(5).view(A)
2651 b = np.arange(1, 3).view(A)
2652 s = np.arange(5).view(A)
2653 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'left'), A))
2654 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'right'), A))
2655 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'left', s), A))
2656 assert_(not isinstance(a.searchsorted(b, 'right', s), A))
2657  
2658 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", np.typecodes["All"])
2659 def test_argpartition_out_of_range(self, dtype):
2660 # Test out of range values in kth raise an error, gh-5469
2661 d = np.arange(10).astype(dtype=dtype)
2662 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 10)
2663 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, -11)
2664  
2665 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", np.typecodes["All"])
2666 def test_partition_out_of_range(self, dtype):
2667 # Test out of range values in kth raise an error, gh-5469
2668 d = np.arange(10).astype(dtype=dtype)
2669 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 10)
2670 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, -11)

2672 def test_argpartition_integer(self):
2673 # Test non-integer values in kth raise an error/
2674 d = np.arange(10)
2675 assert_raises(TypeError, d.argpartition, 9.)
2676 # Test also for generic type argpartition, which uses sorting
2677 # and used to not bound check kth
2678 d_obj = np.arange(10, dtype=object)
2679 assert_raises(TypeError, d_obj.argpartition, 9.)
2680  
2681 def test_partition_integer(self):
2682 # Test out of range values in kth raise an error, gh-5469
2683 d = np.arange(10)
2684 assert_raises(TypeError, d.partition, 9.)
2685 # Test also for generic type partition, which uses sorting
2686 # and used to not bound check kth
2687 d_obj = np.arange(10, dtype=object)
2688 assert_raises(TypeError, d_obj.partition, 9.)

2690 @pytest.mark.parametrize("kth_dtype", np.typecodes["AllInteger"])
2691 def test_partition_empty_array(self, kth_dtype):
2692 # check axis handling for multidimensional empty arrays
2693 kth = np.array(0, dtype=kth_dtype)[()]
2694 a = np.array([])
2695 a.shape = (3, 2, 1, 0)
2696 for axis in range(-a.ndim, a.ndim):
2697 msg = 'test empty array partition with axis={0}'.format(axis)
2698 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=axis), a, msg)
2699 msg = 'test empty array partition with axis=None'
2700 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=None), a.ravel(), msg)
2701  
2702 @pytest.mark.parametrize("kth_dtype", np.typecodes["AllInteger"])
2703 def test_argpartition_empty_array(self, kth_dtype):
2704 # check axis handling for multidimensional empty arrays
2705 kth = np.array(0, dtype=kth_dtype)[()]
2706 a = np.array([])
2707 a.shape = (3, 2, 1, 0)
2708 for axis in range(-a.ndim, a.ndim):
2709 msg = 'test empty array argpartition with axis={0}'.format(axis)
2710 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=axis),
2711 np.zeros_like(a, dtype=np.intp), msg)
2712 msg = 'test empty array argpartition with axis=None'
2713 assert_equal(np.partition(a, kth, axis=None),
2714 np.zeros_like(a.ravel(), dtype=np.intp), msg)
2715  
2716 def test_partition(self):
2717 d = np.arange(10)
2718 assert_raises(TypeError, np.partition, d, 2, kind=1)
2719 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 2, kind="nonsense")
2720 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 2, kind="nonsense")
2721 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2, axis=0, kind="nonsense")
2722 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2, axis=0, kind="nonsense")
2723 for k in ("introselect",):
2724 d = np.array([])
2725 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k), d)
2726 assert_array_equal(np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k), d)
2727 d = np.ones(1)
2728 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k)[0], d)
2729 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2730 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2731  
2732 # kth not modified
2733 kth = np.array([30, 15, 5])
2734 okth = kth.copy()
2735 np.partition(np.arange(40), kth)
2736 assert_array_equal(kth, okth)
2737  
2738 for r in ([2, 1], [1, 2], [1, 1]):
2739 d = np.array(r)
2740 tgt = np.sort(d)
2741 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k)[0], tgt[0])
2742 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 1, kind=k)[1], tgt[1])
2743 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2744 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2745 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 1, kind=k)],
2746 np.partition(d, 1, kind=k))
2747 for i in range(d.size):
2748 d[i:].partition(0, kind=k)
2749 assert_array_equal(d, tgt)
2750  
2751 for r in ([3, 2, 1], [1, 2, 3], [2, 1, 3], [2, 3, 1],
2752 [1, 1, 1], [1, 2, 2], [2, 2, 1], [1, 2, 1]):
2753 d = np.array(r)
2754 tgt = np.sort(d)
2755 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k)[0], tgt[0])
2756 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 1, kind=k)[1], tgt[1])
2757 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 2, kind=k)[2], tgt[2])
2758 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2759 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2760 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 1, kind=k)],
2761 np.partition(d, 1, kind=k))
2762 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 2, kind=k)],
2763 np.partition(d, 2, kind=k))
2764 for i in range(d.size):
2765 d[i:].partition(0, kind=k)
2766 assert_array_equal(d, tgt)
2767  
2768 d = np.ones(50)
2769 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, 0, kind=k), d)
2770 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 0, kind=k)],
2771 np.partition(d, 0, kind=k))
2772  
2773 # sorted
2774 d = np.arange(49)
2775 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 5, kind=k)[5], 5)
2776 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 15, kind=k)[15], 15)
2777 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 5, kind=k)],
2778 np.partition(d, 5, kind=k))
2779 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 15, kind=k)],
2780 np.partition(d, 15, kind=k))
2781  
2782 # rsorted
2783 d = np.arange(47)[::-1]
2784 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 6, kind=k)[6], 6)
2785 assert_equal(np.partition(d, 16, kind=k)[16], 16)
2786 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 6, kind=k)],
2787 np.partition(d, 6, kind=k))
2788 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 16, kind=k)],
2789 np.partition(d, 16, kind=k))
2790  
2791 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, -6, kind=k),
2792 np.partition(d, 41, kind=k))
2793 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, -16, kind=k),
2794 np.partition(d, 31, kind=k))
2795 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, -6, kind=k)],
2796 np.partition(d, 41, kind=k))
2797  
2798 # median of 3 killer, O(n^2) on pure median 3 pivot quickselect
2799 # exercises the median of median of 5 code used to keep O(n)
2800 d = np.arange(1000000)
2801 x = np.roll(d, d.size // 2)
2802 mid = x.size // 2 + 1
2803 assert_equal(np.partition(x, mid)[mid], mid)
2804 d = np.arange(1000001)
2805 x = np.roll(d, d.size // 2 + 1)
2806 mid = x.size // 2 + 1
2807 assert_equal(np.partition(x, mid)[mid], mid)
2808  
2809 # max
2810 d = np.ones(10)
2811 d[1] = 4
2812 assert_equal(np.partition(d, (2, -1))[-1], 4)
2813 assert_equal(np.partition(d, (2, -1))[2], 1)
2814 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, (2, -1))][-1], 4)
2815 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, (2, -1))][2], 1)
2816 d[1] = np.nan
2817 assert_(np.isnan(d[np.argpartition(d, (2, -1))][-1]))
2818 assert_(np.isnan(np.partition(d, (2, -1))[-1]))
2819  
2820 # equal elements
2821 d = np.arange(47) % 7
2822 tgt = np.sort(np.arange(47) % 7)
2823 np.random.shuffle(d)
2824 for i in range(d.size):
2825 assert_equal(np.partition(d, i, kind=k)[i], tgt[i])
2826 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 6, kind=k)],
2827 np.partition(d, 6, kind=k))
2828 assert_array_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, 16, kind=k)],
2829 np.partition(d, 16, kind=k))
2830 for i in range(d.size):
2831 d[i:].partition(0, kind=k)
2832 assert_array_equal(d, tgt)
2833  
2834 d = np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 7,
2835 7, 7, 7, 7, 7, 9])
2836 kth = [0, 3, 19, 20]
2837 assert_equal(np.partition(d, kth, kind=k)[kth], (0, 3, 7, 7))
2838 assert_equal(d[np.argpartition(d, kth, kind=k)][kth], (0, 3, 7, 7))
2839  
2840 d = np.array([2, 1])
2841 d.partition(0, kind=k)
2842 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2)
2843 assert_raises(np.AxisError, d.partition, 3, axis=1)
2844 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 2)
2845 assert_raises(np.AxisError, np.partition, d, 2, axis=1)
2846 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2)
2847 assert_raises(np.AxisError, d.argpartition, 3, axis=1)
2848 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 2)
2849 assert_raises(np.AxisError, np.argpartition, d, 2, axis=1)
2850 d = np.arange(10).reshape((2, 5))
2851 d.partition(1, axis=0, kind=k)
2852 d.partition(4, axis=1, kind=k)
2853 np.partition(d, 1, axis=0, kind=k)
2854 np.partition(d, 4, axis=1, kind=k)
2855 np.partition(d, 1, axis=None, kind=k)
2856 np.partition(d, 9, axis=None, kind=k)
2857 d.argpartition(1, axis=0, kind=k)
2858 d.argpartition(4, axis=1, kind=k)
2859 np.argpartition(d, 1, axis=0, kind=k)
2860 np.argpartition(d, 4, axis=1, kind=k)
2861 np.argpartition(d, 1, axis=None, kind=k)
2862 np.argpartition(d, 9, axis=None, kind=k)
2863 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 2, axis=0)
2864 assert_raises(ValueError, d.partition, 11, axis=1)
2865 assert_raises(TypeError, d.partition, 2, axis=None)
2866 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 9, axis=1)
2867 assert_raises(ValueError, np.partition, d, 11, axis=None)
2868 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 2, axis=0)
2869 assert_raises(ValueError, d.argpartition, 11, axis=1)
2870 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 9, axis=1)
2871 assert_raises(ValueError, np.argpartition, d, 11, axis=None)
2872  
2873 td = [(dt, s) for dt in [np.int32, np.float32, np.complex64]
2874 for s in (9, 16)]
2875 for dt, s in td:
2876 aae = assert_array_equal
2877 at = assert_
2878  
2879 d = np.arange(s, dtype=dt)
2880 np.random.shuffle(d)
2881 d1 = np.tile(np.arange(s, dtype=dt), (4, 1))
2882 map(np.random.shuffle, d1)
2883 d0 = np.transpose(d1)
2884 for i in range(d.size):
2885 p = np.partition(d, i, kind=k)
2886 assert_equal(p[i], i)
2887 # all before are smaller
2888 assert_array_less(p[:i], p[i])
2889 # all after are larger
2890 assert_array_less(p[i], p[i + 1:])
2891 aae(p, d[np.argpartition(d, i, kind=k)])
2892  
2893 p = np.partition(d1, i, axis=1, kind=k)
2894 aae(p[:, i], np.array([i] * d1.shape[0], dtype=dt))
2895 # array_less does not seem to work right
2896 at((p[:, :i].T <= p[:, i]).all(),
2897 msg="%d: %r <= %r" % (i, p[:, i], p[:, :i].T))
2898 at((p[:, i + 1:].T > p[:, i]).all(),
2899 msg="%d: %r < %r" % (i, p[:, i], p[:, i + 1:].T))
2900 aae(p, d1[np.arange(d1.shape[0])[:, None],
2901 np.argpartition(d1, i, axis=1, kind=k)])
2902  
2903 p = np.partition(d0, i, axis=0, kind=k)
2904 aae(p[i, :], np.array([i] * d1.shape[0], dtype=dt))
2905 # array_less does not seem to work right
2906 at((p[:i, :] <= p[i, :]).all(),
2907 msg="%d: %r <= %r" % (i, p[i, :], p[:i, :]))
2908 at((p[i + 1:, :] > p[i, :]).all(),
2909 msg="%d: %r < %r" % (i, p[i, :], p[:, i + 1:]))
2910 aae(p, d0[np.argpartition(d0, i, axis=0, kind=k),
2911 np.arange(d0.shape[1])[None, :]])
2912  
2913 # check inplace
2914 dc = d.copy()
2915 dc.partition(i, kind=k)
2916 assert_equal(dc, np.partition(d, i, kind=k))
2917 dc = d0.copy()
2918 dc.partition(i, axis=0, kind=k)
2919 assert_equal(dc, np.partition(d0, i, axis=0, kind=k))
2920 dc = d1.copy()
2921 dc.partition(i, axis=1, kind=k)
2922 assert_equal(dc, np.partition(d1, i, axis=1, kind=k))
2923  
2924 def assert_partitioned(self, d, kth):
2925 prev = 0
2926 for k in np.sort(kth):
2927 assert_array_less(d[prev:k], d[k], err_msg='kth %d' % k)
2928 assert_((d[k:] >= d[k]).all(),
2929 msg="kth %d, %r not greater equal %d" % (k, d[k:], d[k]))
2930 prev = k + 1
2931

3025 def test_partition_unicode_kind(self):

3031 def test_partition_fuzz(self):
3032 # a few rounds of random data testing
3033 for j in range(10, 30):
3034 for i in range(1, j - 2):
3035 d = np.arange(j)
3036 np.random.shuffle(d)
3037 d = d % np.random.randint(2, 30)
3038 idx = np.random.randint(d.size)
3039 kth = [0, idx, i, i + 1]
3040 tgt = np.sort(d)[kth]
3041 assert_array_equal(np.partition(d, kth)[kth], tgt,
3042 err_msg="data: %r\n kth: %r" % (d, kth))

3044 @pytest.mark.parametrize("kth_dtype", np.typecodes["AllInteger"])
3045 def test_argpartition_gh5524(self, kth_dtype):

3047 kth = np.array(1, dtype=kth_dtype)[()]
3048 d = [6, 7, 3, 2, 9, 0]
3049 p = np.argpartition(d, kth)
  • E231 Missing whitespace after ','

3052 def test_flatten(self):
3053 x0 = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]], np.int32)
3054 x1 = np.array([[[1, 2], [3, 4]], [[5, 6], [7, 8]]], np.int32)
3055 y0 = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], np.int32)
3056 y0f = np.array([1, 4, 2, 5, 3, 6], np.int32)
3057 y1 = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8], np.int32)
3058 y1f = np.array([1, 5, 3, 7, 2, 6, 4, 8], np.int32)
3059 assert_equal(x0.flatten(), y0)
3060 assert_equal(x0.flatten('F'), y0f)
3061 assert_equal(x0.flatten('F'), x0.T.flatten())
3062 assert_equal(x1.flatten(), y1)
3063 assert_equal(x1.flatten('F'), y1f)
3064 assert_equal(x1.flatten('F'), x1.T.flatten())
3065  
3066  
  • E303 Too many blank lines (2)

3070 b = np.array([[0, 1], [1, 0]])

  • E303 Too many blank lines (2)
3089 # gemm vs syrk optimizations
3090 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3091 eaf = a.astype(et)
3092 assert_equal(func(eaf, eaf), eaf)
3093 assert_equal(func(eaf.T, eaf), eaf)
3094 assert_equal(func(eaf, eaf.T), eaf)
3095 assert_equal(func(eaf.T, eaf.T), eaf)
3096 assert_equal(func(eaf.T.copy(), eaf), eaf)
3097 assert_equal(func(eaf, eaf.T.copy()), eaf)
3098 assert_equal(func(eaf.T.copy(), eaf.T.copy()), eaf)
3099  
3100 # syrk validations
3101 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3102 eaf = a.astype(et)
3103 ebf = b.astype(et)
3104 assert_equal(func(ebf, ebf), eaf)
3105 assert_equal(func(ebf.T, ebf), eaf)
3106 assert_equal(func(ebf, ebf.T), eaf)
3107 assert_equal(func(ebf.T, ebf.T), eaf)
3108  
3109 # syrk - different shape, stride, and view validations
3110 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3111 edf = d.astype(et)
3112 assert_equal(
3113 func(edf[::-1, :], edf.T),
3114 func(edf[::-1, :].copy(), edf.T.copy())
3115 )
3116 assert_equal(
3117 func(edf[:, ::-1], edf.T),
3118 func(edf[:, ::-1].copy(), edf.T.copy())
3119 )
3120 assert_equal(
3121 func(edf, edf[::-1, :].T),
3122 func(edf, edf[::-1, :].T.copy())
3123 )
3124 assert_equal(
3125 func(edf, edf[:, ::-1].T),
3126 func(edf, edf[:, ::-1].T.copy())
3127 )
3128 assert_equal(
3129 func(edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :], edf[::2, :].T),
3130 func(edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :].copy(), edf[::2, :].T.copy())
3131 )
3132 assert_equal(
3133 func(edf[::2, :], edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :].T),
3134 func(edf[::2, :].copy(), edf[:edf.shape[0] // 2, :].T.copy())
3135 )
3136  
3137 # syrk - different shape
3138 for et in [np.float32, np.float64, np.complex64, np.complex128]:
3139 edf = d.astype(et)
3140 eddtf = ddt.astype(et)
3141 edtdf = dtd.astype(et)
3142 assert_equal(func(edf, edf.T), eddtf)
3143 assert_equal(func(edf.T, edf), edtdf)
3144  
3145 @pytest.mark.parametrize('func', (np.dot, np.matmul))
3146 @pytest.mark.parametrize('dtype', 'ifdFD')
3147 def test_no_dgemv(self, func, dtype):
3148 # check vector arg for contiguous before gemv
3149 # gh-12156
3150 a = np.arange(8.0, dtype=dtype).reshape(2, 4)
3151 b = np.broadcast_to(1., (4, 1))
3152 ret1 = func(a, b)
3153 ret2 = func(a, b.copy())
3154 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3155  
3156 ret1 = func(b.T, a.T)
3157 ret2 = func(b.T.copy(), a.T)
3158 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3159  
3160 # check for unaligned data
3161 dt = np.dtype(dtype)
3162 a = np.zeros(8 * dt.itemsize // 2 + 1, dtype='int16')[1:].view(dtype)
3163 a = a.reshape(2, 4)
3164 b = a[0]
3165 # make sure it is not aligned
3166 assert_(a.__array_interface__['data'][0] % dt.itemsize != 0)
3167 ret1 = func(a, b)
3168 ret2 = func(a.copy(), b.copy())
3169 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3170  
3171 ret1 = func(b.T, a.T)
3172 ret2 = func(b.T.copy(), a.T.copy())
3173 assert_equal(ret1, ret2)
3174  
3175 def test_dot(self):
3176 a = np.array([[1, 0], [0, 1]])
3177 b = np.array([[0, 1], [1, 0]])
3178 c = np.array([[9, 1], [1, -9]])
3179 # function versus methods
3180 assert_equal(np.dot(a, b), a.dot(b))
3181 assert_equal(np.dot(np.dot(a, b), c), a.dot(b).dot(c))
3182  
3183 # test passing in an output array
3184 c = np.zeros_like(a)
3185 a.dot(b, c)
3186 assert_equal(c, np.dot(a, b))
3187  
3188 # test keyword args
3189 c = np.zeros_like(a)
3190 a.dot(b=b, out=c)
3191 assert_equal(c, np.dot(a, b))
3192  
3193 def test_dot_type_mismatch(self):
3194 c = 1.
  • E231 Missing whitespace after ','
3195 A = np.array((1,1), dtype='i,i')
3196  
3197 assert_raises(TypeError, np.dot, c, A)
3198 assert_raises(TypeError, np.dot, A, c)
3199  
3200 def test_dot_out_mem_overlap(self):
3201 np.random.seed(1)
3202  
3203 # Test BLAS and non-BLAS code paths, including all dtypes
3204 # that dot() supports
3205 dtypes = [np.dtype(code) for code in np.typecodes['All']
3206 if code not in 'USVM']
3207 for dtype in dtypes:
3208 a = np.random.rand(3, 3).astype(dtype)
3209  
3210 # Valid dot() output arrays must be aligned
3211 b = _aligned_zeros((3, 3), dtype=dtype)
3212 b[...] = np.random.rand(3, 3)
3213  
3214 y = np.dot(a, b)
3215 x = np.dot(a, b, out=b)
3216 assert_equal(x, y, err_msg=repr(dtype))
3217  
3218 # Check invalid output array
3219 assert_raises(ValueError, np.dot, a, b, out=b[::2])
3220 assert_raises(ValueError, np.dot, a, b, out=b.T)
3221  
3222 def test_dot_matmul_out(self):
3223 # gh-9641
3224 class Sub(np.ndarray):
3225 pass
3226 a = np.ones((2, 2)).view(Sub)
3227 b = np.ones((2, 2)).view(Sub)
3228 out = np.ones((2, 2))
3229  
3230 # make sure out can be any ndarray (not only subclass of inputs)
3231 np.dot(a, b, out=out)
3232 np.matmul(a, b, out=out)
3233  
3234 def test_dot_matmul_inner_array_casting_fails(self):
3235  
3236 class A:
3237 def __array__(self, *args, **kwargs):
3238 raise NotImplementedError
3239  
3240 # Don't override the error from calling __array__()
3241 assert_raises(NotImplementedError, np.dot, A(), A())
3242 assert_raises(NotImplementedError, np.matmul, A(), A())
3243 assert_raises(NotImplementedError, np.inner, A(), A())
3244  
3245 def test_matmul_out(self):
3246 # overlapping memory
3247 a = np.arange(18).reshape(2, 3, 3)
3248 b = np.matmul(a, a)
3249 c = np.matmul(a, a, out=a)
3250 assert_(c is a)
3251 assert_equal(c, b)
3252 a = np.arange(18).reshape(2, 3, 3)
3253 c = np.matmul(a, a, out=a[::-1, ...])
3254 assert_(c.base is a.base)
3255 assert_equal(c, b)
3256  
3257 def test_diagonal(self):
3258 a = np.arange(12).reshape((3, 4))
3259 assert_equal(a.diagonal(), [0, 5, 10])
3260 assert_equal(a.diagonal(0), [0, 5, 10])
3261 assert_equal(a.diagonal(1), [1, 6, 11])
3262 assert_equal(a.diagonal(-1), [4, 9])
3263 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.diagonal, axis1=0, axis2=5)
3264 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.diagonal, axis1=5, axis2=0)
3265 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.diagonal, axis1=5, axis2=5)
3266 assert_raises(ValueError, a.diagonal, axis1=1, axis2=1)
3267  
3268 b = np.arange(8).reshape((2, 2, 2))
3269 assert_equal(b.diagonal(), [[0, 6], [1, 7]])
3270 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0), [[0, 6], [1, 7]])
3271 assert_equal(b.diagonal(1), [[2], [3]])
3272 assert_equal(b.diagonal(-1), [[4], [5]])
3273 assert_raises(ValueError, b.diagonal, axis1=0, axis2=0)
3274 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0, 1, 2), [[0, 3], [4, 7]])
3275 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0, 0, 1), [[0, 6], [1, 7]])
3276 assert_equal(b.diagonal(offset=1, axis1=0, axis2=2), [[1], [3]])
3277 # Order of axis argument doesn't matter:
3278 assert_equal(b.diagonal(0, 2, 1), [[0, 3], [4, 7]])
3279  
3280 def test_diagonal_view_notwriteable(self):
3281 a = np.eye(3).diagonal()
3282 assert_(not a.flags.writeable)
3283 assert_(not a.flags.owndata)
3284  
3285 a = np.diagonal(np.eye(3))
3286 assert_(not a.flags.writeable)
3287 assert_(not a.flags.owndata)
3288  
3289 a = np.diag(np.eye(3))
3290 assert_(not a.flags.writeable)
3291 assert_(not a.flags.owndata)
3292  
3293 def test_diagonal_memleak(self):
3294 # Regression test for a bug that crept in at one point
3295 a = np.zeros((100, 100))
3296 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
3297 assert_(sys.getrefcount(a) < 50)
3298 for i in range(100):
3299 a.diagonal()
3300 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
3301 assert_(sys.getrefcount(a) < 50)
3302  
3303 def test_size_zero_memleak(self):
3304 # Regression test for issue 9615
3305 # Exercises a special-case code path for dot products of length
3306 # zero in cblasfuncs (making it is specific to floating dtypes).
3307 a = np.array([], dtype=np.float64)
3308 x = np.array(2.0)
3309 for _ in range(100):
3310 np.dot(a, a, out=x)
3311 if HAS_REFCOUNT:
3312 assert_(sys.getrefcount(x) < 50)
3313  
3314 def test_trace(self):
3315 a = np.arange(12).reshape((3, 4))
3316 assert_equal(a.trace(), 15)
3317 assert_equal(a.trace(0), 15)
3318 assert_equal(a.trace(1), 18)
3319 assert_equal(a.trace(-1), 13)
3320  
3321 b = np.arange(8).reshape((2, 2, 2))
3322 assert_equal(b.trace(), [6, 8])
3323 assert_equal(b.trace(0), [6, 8])
3324 assert_equal(b.trace(1), [2, 3])
3325 assert_equal(b.trace(-1), [4, 5])
3326 assert_equal(b.trace(0, 0, 1), [6, 8])
3327 assert_equal(b.trace(0, 0, 2), [5, 9])
3328 assert_equal(b.trace(0, 1, 2), [3, 11])
3329 assert_equal(b.trace(offset=1, axis1=0, axis2=2), [1, 3])
3330  
3331 out = np.array(1)
3332 ret = a.trace(out=out)
3333 assert ret is out
3334  
3335 def test_trace_subclass(self):
3336 # The class would need to overwrite trace to ensure single-element
3337 # output also has the right subclass.
3338 class MyArray(np.ndarray):
3339 pass
3340  
3341 b = np.arange(8).reshape((2, 2, 2)).view(MyArray)
3342 t = b.trace()
3343 assert_(isinstance(t, MyArray))
3344  
3345 def test_put(self):
3346 icodes = np.typecodes['AllInteger']
3347 fcodes = np.typecodes['AllFloat']
3348 for dt in icodes + fcodes + 'O':
3349 tgt = np.array([0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 5], dtype=dt)
3350  
3351 # test 1-d
3352 a = np.zeros(6, dtype=dt)
3353 a.put([1, 3, 5], [1, 3, 5])
3354 assert_equal(a, tgt)
3355  
3356 # test 2-d
3357 a = np.zeros((2, 3), dtype=dt)
3358 a.put([1, 3, 5], [1, 3, 5])
3359 assert_equal(a, tgt.reshape(2, 3))
3360  
3361 for dt in '?':
3362 tgt = np.array([False, True, False, True, False, True], dtype=dt)
3363  
3364 # test 1-d
3365 a = np.zeros(6, dtype=dt)
3366 a.put([1, 3, 5], [True]*3)
3367 assert_equal(a, tgt)
3368  
3369 # test 2-d
3370 a = np.zeros((2, 3), dtype=dt)
3371 a.put([1, 3, 5], [True]*3)
3372 assert_equal(a, tgt.reshape(2, 3))
3373  
3374 # check must be writeable
3375 a = np.zeros(6)
3376 a.flags.writeable = False
3377 assert_raises(ValueError, a.put, [1, 3, 5], [1, 3, 5])
3378  
3379 # when calling np.put, make sure a
3380 # TypeError is raised if the object
3381 # isn't an ndarray
3382 bad_array = [1, 2, 3]
3383 assert_raises(TypeError, np.put, bad_array, [0, 2], 5)
3384  
3385 def test_ravel(self):
3386 a = np.array([[0, 1], [2, 3]])
3387 assert_equal(a.ravel(), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3388 assert_(not a.ravel().flags.owndata)
3389 assert_equal(a.ravel('F'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3390 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='C'), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3391 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='F'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3392 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3393 assert_(not a.ravel(order='A').flags.owndata)
3394 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3395 assert_(not a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3396 assert_equal(a.ravel(), a.reshape(-1))
3397  
3398 a = np.array([[0, 1], [2, 3]], order='F')
3399 assert_equal(a.ravel(), [0, 1, 2, 3])
3400 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3401 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), [0, 2, 1, 3])
3402 assert_(not a.ravel(order='A').flags.owndata)
3403 assert_(not a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3404 assert_equal(a.ravel(), a.reshape(-1))
3405 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), a.reshape(-1, order='A'))
3406  
3407 a = np.array([[0, 1], [2, 3]])[::-1, :]
3408 assert_equal(a.ravel(), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3409 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='C'), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3410 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='F'), [2, 0, 3, 1])
3411 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='A'), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3412 # 'K' doesn't reverse the axes of negative strides
3413 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), [2, 3, 0, 1])
3414 assert_(a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3415  
3416 # Test simple 1-d copy behaviour:
3417 a = np.arange(10)[::2]
3418 assert_(a.ravel('K').flags.owndata)
3419 assert_(a.ravel('C').flags.owndata)
3420 assert_(a.ravel('F').flags.owndata)
3421  
3422 # Not contiguous and 1-sized axis with non matching stride
3423 a = np.arange(2**3 * 2)[::2]
3424 a = a.reshape(2, 1, 2, 2).swapaxes(-1, -2)
3425 strides = list(a.strides)
3426 strides[1] = 123
3427 a.strides = strides
3428 assert_(a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3429 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), np.arange(0, 15, 2))
3430  
3431 # contiguous and 1-sized axis with non matching stride works:
3432 a = np.arange(2**3)
3433 a = a.reshape(2, 1, 2, 2).swapaxes(-1, -2)
3434 strides = list(a.strides)
3435 strides[1] = 123
3436 a.strides = strides
3437 assert_(np.may_share_memory(a.ravel(order='K'), a))
3438 assert_equal(a.ravel(order='K'), np.arange(2**3))
3439  
3440 # Test negative strides (not very interesting since non-contiguous):
3441 a = np.arange(4)[::-1].reshape(2, 2)
3442 assert_(a.ravel(order='C').flags.owndata)
3443 assert_(a.ravel(order='K').flags.owndata)
3444 assert_equal(a.ravel('C'), [3, 2, 1, 0])
3445 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), [3, 2, 1, 0])
3446  
3447 # 1-element tidy strides test:
3448 a = np.array([[1]])
3449 a.strides = (123, 432)
3450 # If the following stride is not 8, NPY_RELAXED_STRIDES_DEBUG is
3451 # messing them up on purpose:
3452 if np.ones(1).strides == (8,):
3453 assert_(np.may_share_memory(a.ravel('K'), a))
3454 assert_equal(a.ravel('K').strides, (a.dtype.itemsize,))
3455  
3456 for order in ('C', 'F', 'A', 'K'):
3457 # 0-d corner case:
3458 a = np.array(0)
3459 assert_equal(a.ravel(order), [0])
3460 assert_(np.may_share_memory(a.ravel(order), a))
3461  
3462 # Test that certain non-inplace ravels work right (mostly) for 'K':
3463 b = np.arange(2**4 * 2)[::2].reshape(2, 2, 2, 2)
3464 a = b[..., ::2]
3465 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), [0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28])
3466 assert_equal(a.ravel('C'), [0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28])
3467 assert_equal(a.ravel('A'), [0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28])
3468 assert_equal(a.ravel('F'), [0, 16, 8, 24, 4, 20, 12, 28])
3469  
3470 a = b[::2, ...]
3471 assert_equal(a.ravel('K'), [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14])
3472 assert_equal(a.ravel('C'), [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14])
3473 assert_equal(a.ravel('A'), [0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14])
3474 assert_equal(a.ravel('F'), [0, 8, 4, 12, 2, 10, 6, 14])
3475  
3476 def test_ravel_subclass(self):
3477 class ArraySubclass(np.ndarray):
3478 pass
3479  
3480 a = np.arange(10).view(ArraySubclass)
3481 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('C'), ArraySubclass))
3482 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('F'), ArraySubclass))
3483 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('A'), ArraySubclass))
3484 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('K'), ArraySubclass))
3485  
3486 a = np.arange(10)[::2].view(ArraySubclass)
3487 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('C'), ArraySubclass))
3488 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('F'), ArraySubclass))
3489 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('A'), ArraySubclass))
3490 assert_(isinstance(a.ravel('K'), ArraySubclass))
3491  
3492 def test_swapaxes(self):
3493 a = np.arange(1*2*3*4).reshape(1, 2, 3, 4).copy()
3494 idx = np.indices(a.shape)
3495 assert_(a.flags['OWNDATA'])
3496 b = a.copy()
3497 # check exceptions
3498 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, -5, 0)
3499 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, 4, 0)
3500 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, 0, -5)
3501 assert_raises(np.AxisError, a.swapaxes, 0, 4)
3502  
3503 for i in range(-4, 4):
3504 for j in range(-4, 4):
3505 for k, src in enumerate((a, b)):
3506 c = src.swapaxes(i, j)
3507 # check shape
3508 shape = list(src.shape)
3509 shape[i] = src.shape[j]
3510 shape[j] = src.shape[i]
3511 assert_equal(c.shape, shape, str((i, j, k)))
3512 # check array contents
3513 i0, i1, i2, i3 = [dim-1 for dim in c.shape]
3514 j0, j1, j2, j3 = [dim-1 for dim in src.shape]
3515 assert_equal(src[idx[j0], idx[j1], idx[j2], idx[j3]],
3516 c[idx[i0], idx[i1], idx[i2], idx[i3]],
3517 str((i, j, k)))
3518 # check a view is always returned, gh-5260
3519 assert_(not c.flags['OWNDATA'], str((i, j, k)))
3520 # check on non-contiguous input array
3521 if k == 1:
3522 b = c
3523  
3524 def test_conjugate(self):
3525 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 23+23.0j])
3526 ac = a.conj()
3527 assert_equal(a.real, ac.real)
3528 assert_equal(a.imag, -ac.imag)
3529 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3530 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3531  
3532 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 23+23.0j], 'F')
3533 ac = a.conj()
3534 assert_equal(a.real, ac.real)
3535 assert_equal(a.imag, -ac.imag)
3536 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3537 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3538  
3539 a = np.array([1, 2, 3])
3540 ac = a.conj()
3541 assert_equal(a, ac)
3542 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3543 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3544  
3545 a = np.array([1.0, 2.0, 3.0])
3546 ac = a.conj()
3547 assert_equal(a, ac)
3548 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3549 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3550  
3551 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 1, 2.0], object)
3552 ac = a.conj()
3553 assert_equal(ac, [k.conjugate() for k in a])
3554 assert_equal(ac, a.conjugate())
3555 assert_equal(ac, np.conjugate(a))
3556  
3557 a = np.array([1-1j, 1, 2.0, 'f'], object)
3558 assert_raises(TypeError, lambda: a.conj())
3559 assert_raises(TypeError, lambda: a.conjugate())
3560  
3561 def test_conjugate_out(self):
3562 # Minimal test for the out argument being passed on correctly
3563 # NOTE: The ability to pass `out` is currently undocumented!
3564 a = np.array([1-1j, 1+1j, 23+23.0j])
3565 out = np.empty_like(a)
3566 res = a.conjugate(out)
3567 assert res is out
3568 assert_array_equal(out, a.conjugate())
3569  
3570 def test__complex__(self):
3571 dtypes = ['i1', 'i2', 'i4', 'i8',
3572 'u1', 'u2', 'u4', 'u8',
3573 'f', 'd', 'g', 'F', 'D', 'G',
3574 '?', 'O']
3575 for dt in dtypes:
3576 a = np.array(7, dtype=dt)
3577 b = np.array([7], dtype=dt)
3578 c = np.array([[[[[7]]]]], dtype=dt)
3579  
3580 msg = 'dtype: {0}'.format(dt)
3581 ap = complex(a)
3582 assert_equal(ap, a, msg)
3583 bp = complex(b)
3584 assert_equal(bp, b, msg)
3585 cp = complex(c)
3586 assert_equal(cp, c, msg)
3587  
3588 def test__complex__should_not_work(self):
3589 dtypes = ['i1', 'i2', 'i4', 'i8',
3590 'u1', 'u2', 'u4', 'u8',
3591 'f', 'd', 'g', 'F', 'D', 'G',
3592 '?', 'O']
3593 for dt in dtypes:
3594 a = np.array([1, 2, 3], dtype=dt)
3595 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, a)
3596  
3597 dt = np.dtype([('a', 'f8'), ('b', 'i1')])
3598 b = np.array((1.0, 3), dtype=dt)
3599 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, b)
3600  
3601 c = np.array([(1.0, 3), (2e-3, 7)], dtype=dt)
3602 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, c)
3603  
3604 d = np.array('1+1j')
3605 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, d)
3606  
3607 e = np.array(['1+1j'], 'U')
3608 assert_raises(TypeError, complex, e)
3609  
  • E302 Expected 2 blank lines, found 1
3610 class TestCequenceMethods:
3611 def test_array_contains(self):
  • E231 Missing whitespace after ','

3615 class TestBinop:
3616 def test_inplace(self):
3617 # test refcount 1 inplace conversion
3618 assert_array_almost_equal(np.array([0.5]) * np.array([1.0, 2.0]),
3619 [0.5, 1.0])
3620  
3621 d = np.array([0.5, 0.5])[::2]
3622 assert_array_almost_equal(d * (d * np.array([1.0, 2.0])),
3623 [0.25, 0.5])
3624  
3625 a = np.array([0.5])
3626 b = np.array([0.5])
3627 c = a + b
3628 c = a - b
3629 c = a * b
3630 c = a / b
3631 assert_equal(a, b)
3632 assert_almost_equal(c, 1.)
3633  
3634 c = a + b * 2. / b * a - a / b
3635 assert_equal(a, b)
3636 assert_equal(c, 0.5)
3637  
3638 # true divide
3639 a = np.array([5])
3640 b = np.array([3])
3641 c = (a * a) / b
3642  
3643 assert_almost_equal(c, 25 / 3)
3644 assert_equal(a, 5)
3645 assert_equal(b, 3)
3646  
3647 # ndarray.__rop__ always calls ufunc
3648 # ndarray.__iop__ always calls ufunc
3649 # ndarray.__op__, __rop__:
3650 # - defer if other has __array_ufunc__ and it is None
3651 # or other is not a subclass and has higher array priority
3652 # - else, call ufunc
3653 def test_ufunc_binop_interaction(self):
3654 # Python method name (without underscores)
3655 # -> (numpy ufunc, has_in_place_version, preferred_dtype)
3656 ops = {
3657 'add': (np.add, True, float),
3658 'sub': (np.subtract, True, float),
3659 'mul': (np.multiply, True, float),
3660 'truediv': (np.true_divide, True, float),
3661 'floordiv': (np.floor_divide, True, float),
3662 'mod': (np.remainder, True, float),
3663 'divmod': (np.divmod, False, float),
3664 'pow': (np.power, True, int),
3665 'lshift': (np.left_shift, True, int),
3666 'rshift': (np.right_shift, True, int),
3667 'and': (np.bitwise_and, True, int),
3668 'xor': (np.bitwise_xor, True, int),
3669 'or': (np.bitwise_or, True, int),
3670 'matmul': (np.matmul, False, float),
3671 # 'ge': (np.less_equal, False),
3672 # 'gt': (np.less, False),
3673 # 'le': (np.greater_equal, False),
3674 # 'lt': (np.greater, False),
3675 # 'eq': (np.equal, False),
3676 # 'ne': (np.not_equal, False),
3677 }
3678  
3679 class Coerced(Exception):
3680 pass
3681  
3682 def array_impl(self):
3683 raise Coerced
3684  
3685 def op_impl(self, other):
3686 return "forward"
3687  
3688 def rop_impl(self, other):
3689 return "reverse"
3690  
3691 def iop_impl(self, other):
3692 return "in-place"
3693  
3694 def array_ufunc_impl(self, ufunc, method, *args, **kwargs):
3695 return ("__array_ufunc__", ufunc, method, args, kwargs)
3696  
3697 # Create an object with the given base, in the given module, with a
3698 # bunch of placeholder __op__ methods, and optionally a
3699 # __array_ufunc__ and __array_priority__.
3700 def make_obj(base, array_priority=False, array_ufunc=False,
3701 alleged_module="__main__"):
3702 class_namespace = {"__array__": array_impl}
3703 if array_priority is not False:
3704 class_namespace["__array_priority__"] = array_priority
3705 for op in ops:
3706 class_namespace["__{0}__".format(op)] = op_impl
3707 class_namespace["__r{0}__".format(op)] = rop_impl
3708 class_namespace["__i{0}__".format(op)] = iop_impl
3709 if array_ufunc is not False:
3710 class_namespace["__array_ufunc__"] = array_ufunc
3711 eval_namespace = {"base": base,
3712 "class_namespace": class_namespace,
3713 "__name__": alleged_module,
3714 }
3715 MyType = eval("type('MyType', (base,), class_namespace)",
3716 eval_namespace)
3717 if issubclass(MyType, np.ndarray):
3718 # Use this range to avoid special case weirdnesses around
3719 # divide-by-0, pow(x, 2), overflow due to pow(big, big), etc.
3720 return np.arange(3, 7).reshape(2, 2).view(MyType)
3721 else:
3722 return MyType()
3723  
3724 def check(obj, binop_override_expected, ufunc_override_expected,
3725 inplace_override_expected, check_scalar=True):
3726 for op, (ufunc, has_inplace, dtype) in ops.items():
3727 err_msg = ('op: %s, ufunc: %s, has_inplace: %s, dtype: %s'
3728 % (op, ufunc, has_inplace, dtype))
3729 check_objs = [np.arange(3, 7, dtype=dtype).reshape(2, 2)]
3730 if check_scalar:
3731 check_objs.append(check_objs[0][0])
3732 for arr in check_objs:
3733 arr_method = getattr(arr, "__{0}__".format(op))
3734  
3735 def first_out_arg(result):
3736 if op == "divmod":
3737 assert_(isinstance(result, tuple))
3738 return result[0]
3739 else:
3740 return result
3741  
3742 # arr __op__ obj
3743 if binop_override_expected:
3744 assert_equal(arr_method(obj), NotImplemented, err_msg)
3745 elif ufunc_override_expected:
3746 assert_equal(arr_method(obj)[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3747 err_msg)
3748 else:
3749 if (isinstance(obj, np.ndarray) and
3750 (type(obj).__array_ufunc__ is
3751 np.ndarray.__array_ufunc__)):
3752 # __array__ gets ignored
3753 res = first_out_arg(arr_method(obj))
3754 assert_(res.__class__ is obj.__class__, err_msg)
3755 else:
3756 assert_raises((TypeError, Coerced),
3757 arr_method, obj, err_msg=err_msg)
3758 # obj __op__ arr
3759 arr_rmethod = getattr(arr, "__r{0}__".format(op))
3760 if ufunc_override_expected:
3761 res = arr_rmethod(obj)
3762 assert_equal(res[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3763 err_msg=err_msg)
3764 assert_equal(res[1], ufunc, err_msg=err_msg)
3765 else:
3766 if (isinstance(obj, np.ndarray) and
3767 (type(obj).__array_ufunc__ is
3768 np.ndarray.__array_ufunc__)):
3769 # __array__ gets ignored
3770 res = first_out_arg(arr_rmethod(obj))
3771 assert_(res.__class__ is obj.__class__, err_msg)
3772 else:
3773 # __array_ufunc__ = "asdf" creates a TypeError
3774 assert_raises((TypeError, Coerced),
3775 arr_rmethod, obj, err_msg=err_msg)
3776  
3777 # arr __iop__ obj
3778 # array scalars don't have in-place operators
3779 if has_inplace and isinstance(arr, np.ndarray):
3780 arr_imethod = getattr(arr, "__i{0}__".format(op))
3781 if inplace_override_expected:
3782 assert_equal(arr_method(obj), NotImplemented,
3783 err_msg=err_msg)
3784 elif ufunc_override_expected:
3785 res = arr_imethod(obj)
3786 assert_equal(res[0], "__array_ufunc__", err_msg)
3787 assert_equal(res[1], ufunc, err_msg)
3788 assert_(type(res[-1]["out"]) is tuple, err_msg)
3789 assert_(res[-1]["out"][0] is arr, err_msg)
3790 else:
3791 if (isinstance(obj, np.ndarray) and
3792 (type(obj).__array_ufunc__ is
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
3793 np.ndarray.__array_ufunc__)):
3794 # __array__ gets ignored
3795 assert_(arr_imethod(obj) is arr, err_msg)
3796 else:
3797 assert_raises((TypeError, Coerced),
3798 arr_imethod, obj,
3799 err_msg=err_msg)
3800  
3801 op_fn = getattr(operator, op, None)
3802 if op_fn is None:
3803 op_fn = getattr(operator, op + "_", None)
3804 if op_fn is None:
3805 op_fn = getattr(builtins, op)
3806 assert_equal(op_fn(obj, arr), "forward", err_msg)
3807 if not isinstance(obj, np.ndarray):
3808 if binop_override_expected:
3809 assert_equal(op_fn(arr, obj), "reverse", err_msg)
3810 elif ufunc_override_expected:
3811 assert_equal(op_fn(arr, obj)[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3812 err_msg)
3813 if ufunc_override_expected:
3814 assert_equal(ufunc(obj, arr)[0], "__array_ufunc__",
3815 err_msg)
3816  
3817 # No array priority, no array_ufunc -> nothing called
3818 check(make_obj(object), False, False, False)
3819 # Negative array priority, no array_ufunc -> nothing called
3820 # (has to be very negative, because scalar priority is -1000000.0)
3821 check(make_obj(object, array_priority=-2**30), False, False, False)
3822 # Positive array priority, no array_ufunc -> binops and iops only
3823 check(make_obj(object, array_priority=1), True, False, True)
3824 # ndarray ignores array_priority for ndarray subclasses
3825 check(make_obj(np.ndarray, array_priority=1), False, False, False,
3826 check_scalar=False)
3827 # Positive array_priority and array_ufunc -> array_ufunc only
3828 check(make_obj(object, array_priority=1,
3829 array_ufunc=array_ufunc_impl), False, True, False)
3830 check(make_obj(np.ndarray, array_priority=1,
3831 array_ufunc=array_ufunc_impl), False, True, False)
3832 # array_ufunc set to None -> defer binops only
3833 check(make_obj(object, array_ufunc=None), True, False, False)
3834 check(make_obj(np.ndarray, array_ufunc=None), True, False, False,
3835 check_scalar=False)
3836  
3837 @pytest.mark.parametrize("priority", [None, "runtime error"])
3838 def test_ufunc_binop_bad_array_priority(self, priority):
3839 # Mainly checks that this does not crash. The second array has a lower
3840 # priority than -1 ("error value"). If the __radd__ actually exists,
3841 # bad things can happen (I think via the scalar paths).
3842 # In principle both of these can probably just be errors in the future.
3843 class BadPriority:
3844 @property
3845 def __array_priority__(self):
3846 if priority == "runtime error":
3847 raise RuntimeError("RuntimeError in __array_priority__!")
3848 return priority
3849  
3850 def __radd__(self, other):
3851 return "result"
3852  
3853 class LowPriority(np.ndarray):
3854 __array_priority__ = -1000
3855  
3856 # Priority failure uses the same as scalars (smaller -1000). So the
3857 # LowPriority wins with 'result' for each element (inner operation).
3858 res = np.arange(3).view(LowPriority) + BadPriority()
3859 assert res.shape == (3,)
3860 assert res[0] == 'result'
3861  
3862  
  • E303 Too many blank lines (2)
3863 def test_ufunc_override_normalize_signature(self):
3864 # gh-5674
3865 class SomeClass:
3866 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
3867 return kw
3868  
3869 a = SomeClass()
3870 kw = np.add(a, [1])
3871 assert_('sig' not in kw and 'signature' not in kw)
3872 kw = np.add(a, [1], sig='ii->i')
3873 assert_('sig' not in kw and 'signature' in kw)
3874 assert_equal(kw['signature'], 'ii->i')
3875 kw = np.add(a, [1], signature='ii->i')
3876 assert_('sig' not in kw and 'signature' in kw)
3877 assert_equal(kw['signature'], 'ii->i')
3878  
3879 def test_array_ufunc_index(self):
3880 # Check that index is set appropriately, also if only an output
3881 # is passed on (latter is another regression tests for github bug 4753)
3882 # This also checks implicitly that 'out' is always a tuple.
3883 class CheckIndex:
3884 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
3885 for i, a in enumerate(inputs):
3886 if a is self:
3887 return i
3888 # calls below mean we must be in an output.
3889 for j, a in enumerate(kw['out']):
3890 if a is self:
3891 return (j,)
3892  
3893 a = CheckIndex()
3894 dummy = np.arange(2.)
3895 # 1 input, 1 output
3896 assert_equal(np.sin(a), 0)
3897 assert_equal(np.sin(dummy, a), (0,))
3898 assert_equal(np.sin(dummy, out=a), (0,))
3899 assert_equal(np.sin(dummy, out=(a,)), (0,))
3900 assert_equal(np.sin(a, a), 0)
3901 assert_equal(np.sin(a, out=a), 0)
3902 assert_equal(np.sin(a, out=(a,)), 0)
3903 # 1 input, 2 outputs
3904 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, a), (0,))
3905 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, None, a), (1,))
3906 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, dummy, a), (1,))
3907 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(a, None)), (0,))
3908 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(a, dummy)), (0,))
3909 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(None, a)), (1,))
3910 assert_equal(np.modf(dummy, out=(dummy, a)), (1,))
3911 assert_equal(np.modf(a, out=(dummy, a)), 0)
3912 with assert_raises(TypeError):
3913 # Out argument must be tuple, since there are multiple outputs
3914 np.modf(dummy, out=a)
3915  
3916 assert_raises(ValueError, np.modf, dummy, out=(a,))
3917  
3918 # 2 inputs, 1 output
3919 assert_equal(np.add(a, dummy), 0)
3920 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, a), 1)
3921 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, dummy, a), (0,))
3922 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, a, a), 1)
3923 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, dummy, out=a), (0,))
3924 assert_equal(np.add(dummy, dummy, out=(a,)), (0,))
3925 assert_equal(np.add(a, dummy, out=a), 0)
3926  
3927 def test_out_override(self):
3928 # regression test for github bug 4753
3929 class OutClass(np.ndarray):
3930 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
3931 if 'out' in kw:
3932 tmp_kw = kw.copy()
3933 tmp_kw.pop('out')
3934 func = getattr(ufunc, method)
3935 kw['out'][0][...] = func(*inputs, **tmp_kw)
3936  
3937 A = np.array([0]).view(OutClass)
3938 B = np.array([5])
3939 C = np.array([6])
3940 np.multiply(C, B, A)
3941 assert_equal(A[0], 30)
3942 assert_(isinstance(A, OutClass))
3943 A[0] = 0
3944 np.multiply(C, B, out=A)
3945 assert_equal(A[0], 30)
3946 assert_(isinstance(A, OutClass))
3947  
3948 def test_pow_override_with_errors(self):
3949 # regression test for gh-9112
3950 class PowerOnly(np.ndarray):
3951 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kw):
3952 if ufunc is not np.power:
3953 raise NotImplementedError
3954 return "POWER!"
3955 # explicit cast to float, to ensure the fast power path is taken.
3956 a = np.array(5., dtype=np.float64).view(PowerOnly)
3957 assert_equal(a ** 2.5, "POWER!")
3958 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
3959 a ** 0.5
3960 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
3961 a ** 0
3962 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
3963 a ** 1
3964 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
3965 a ** -1
3966 with assert_raises(NotImplementedError):
3967 a ** 2
3968  
3969 def test_pow_array_object_dtype(self):
3970 # test pow on arrays of object dtype
3971 class SomeClass:
3972 def __init__(self, num=None):
3973 self.num = num
3974  
3975 # want to ensure a fast pow path is not taken
3976 def __mul__(self, other):
3977 raise AssertionError('__mul__ should not be called')
3978  
3979 def __div__(self, other):
3980 raise AssertionError('__div__ should not be called')
3981  
3982 def __pow__(self, exp):
3983 return SomeClass(num=self.num ** exp)
3984  
3985 def __eq__(self, other):
3986 if isinstance(other, SomeClass):
3987 return self.num == other.num
3988  
3989 __rpow__ = __pow__
3990  
3991 def pow_for(exp, arr):
3992 return np.array([x ** exp for x in arr])
3993  
3994 obj_arr = np.array([SomeClass(1), SomeClass(2), SomeClass(3)])
3995  
3996 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 0.5, pow_for(0.5, obj_arr))
3997 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 0, pow_for(0, obj_arr))
3998 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 1, pow_for(1, obj_arr))
3999 assert_equal(obj_arr ** -1, pow_for(-1, obj_arr))
4000 assert_equal(obj_arr ** 2, pow_for(2, obj_arr))
4001  
4002 def test_pos_array_ufunc_override(self):
4003 class A(np.ndarray):
4004 def __array_ufunc__(self, ufunc, method, *inputs, **kwargs):
4005 return getattr(ufunc, method)(*[i.view(np.ndarray) for
4006 i in inputs], **kwargs)
4007 tst = np.array('foo').view(A)
4008 with assert_raises(TypeError):
4009 +tst
4010  
4011  
4012 class TestTemporaryElide:
4013 # elision is only triggered on relatively large arrays
4014  
4015 def test_extension_incref_elide(self):
4016 # test extension (e.g. cython) calling PyNumber_* slots without
4017 # increasing the reference counts
4018 #
4019 # def incref_elide(a):
4020 # d = input.copy() # refcount 1
4021 # return d, d + d # PyNumber_Add without increasing refcount
4022 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import incref_elide
4023 d = np.ones(100000)
4024 orig, res = incref_elide(d)
4025 d + d
4026 # the return original should not be changed to an inplace operation
4027 assert_array_equal(orig, d)
4028 assert_array_equal(res, d + d)
4029  
4030 def test_extension_incref_elide_stack(self):
4031 # scanning if the refcount == 1 object is on the python stack to check
4032 # that we are called directly from python is flawed as object may still
4033 # be above the stack pointer and we have no access to the top of it
4034 #
4035 # def incref_elide_l(d):
4036 # return l[4] + l[4] # PyNumber_Add without increasing refcount
4037 from numpy.core._multiarray_tests import incref_elide_l
4038 # padding with 1 makes sure the object on the stack is not overwritten
  • E741 Ambiguous variable name 'l'
4039 l = [1, 1, 1, 1, np.ones(100000)]
4040 res = incref_elide_l(l)
4041 # the return original should not be changed to an inplace operation
4042 assert_array_equal(l[4], np.ones(100000))
4043 assert_array_equal(res, l[4] + l[4])
4044  
4045 def test_temporary_with_cast(self):
4046 # check that we don't elide into a temporary which would need casting
4047 d = np.ones(200000, dtype=np.int64)
4048 assert_equal(((d + d) + 2**222).dtype, np.dtype('O'))
4049  
4050 r = ((d + d) / 2)
4051 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4052  
4053 r = np.true_divide((d + d), 2)
4054 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4055  
4056 r = ((d + d) / 2.)
4057 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4058  
4059 r = ((d + d) // 2)
4060 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype(np.int64))
4061  
4062 # commutative elision into the astype result
4063 f = np.ones(100000, dtype=np.float32)
4064 assert_equal(((f + f) + f.astype(np.float64)).dtype, np.dtype('f8'))
4065  
4066 # no elision into lower type
4067 d = f.astype(np.float64)
4068 assert_equal(((f + f) + d).dtype, d.dtype)
  • E741 Ambiguous variable name 'l'
4069 l = np.ones(100000, dtype=np.longdouble)
4070 assert_equal(((d + d) + l).dtype, l.dtype)
4071  
4072 # test unary abs with different output dtype
4073 for dt in (np.complex64, np.complex128, np.clongdouble):
4074 c = np.ones(100000, dtype=dt)
4075 r = abs(c * 2.0)
4076 assert_equal(r.dtype, np.dtype('f%d' % (c.itemsize // 2)))
4077  
4078 def test_elide_broadcast(self):
4079 # test no elision on broadcast to higher dimension
4080 # only triggers elision code path in debug mode as triggering it in
4081 # normal mode needs 256kb large matching dimension, so a lot of memory
4082 d = np.ones((2000, 1), dtype=int)
4083 b = np.ones((2000), dtype=bool)
4084 r = (1 - d) + b
4085 assert_equal(r, 1)
4086 assert_equal(r.shape, (2000, 2000))
4087  
4088 def test_elide_scalar(self):
4089 # check inplace op does not create ndarray from scalars
4090 a = np.bool_()
4091 assert_(type(~(a & a)) is np.bool_)
4092  
4093 def test_elide_scalar_readonly(self):
4094 # The imaginary part of a real array is readonly. This needs to go
4095 # through fast_scalar_power which is only called for powers of
4096 # +1, -1, 0, 0.5, and 2, so use 2. Also need valid refcount for
4097 # elision which can be gotten for the imaginary part of a real
4098 # array. Should not error.
4099 a = np.empty(100000, dtype=np.float64)
4100 a.imag ** 2
4101  
4102 def test_elide_readonly(self):
4103 # don't try to elide readonly temporaries
4104 r = np.asarray(np.broadcast_to(np.zeros(1), 100000).flat) * 0.0
4105 assert_equal(r, 0)
4106  
4107 def test_elide_updateifcopy(self):
4108 a = np.ones(2**20)[::2]
4109 b = a.flat.__array__() + 1
4110 del b
4111 assert_equal(a, 1)
4112

4114 class TestCAPI:
4115 def test_IsPythonScalar(self):

4117 assert_(IsPythonScalar(b'foobar'))

4123 @pytest.mark.parametrize("converter",
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4124 [_multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_converter,
4125 _multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_from_sequence])
4126 def test_intp_sequence_converters(self, converter):
4127 # Test simple values (-1 is special for error return paths)
4128 assert converter(10) == (10,)
4129 assert converter(-1) == (-1,)
4130 # A 0-D array looks a bit like a sequence but must take the integer
4131 # path:
4132 assert converter(np.array(123)) == (123,)
4133 # Test simple sequences (intp_from_sequence only supports length 1):
4134 assert converter((10,)) == (10,)
4135 assert converter(np.array([11])) == (11,)
4136  
4137 @pytest.mark.parametrize("converter",
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4138 [_multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_converter,
4139 _multiarray_tests.run_scalar_intp_from_sequence])
4140 @pytest.mark.skipif(IS_PYPY and sys.implementation.version <= (7, 3, 8),
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4141 reason="PyPy bug in error formatting")
4142 def test_intp_sequence_converters_errors(self, converter):
4143 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4144 match="expected a sequence of integers or a single integer, "):
4145 converter(object())
4146 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4147 match="expected a sequence of integers or a single integer, "
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4148 "got '32.0'"):
4149 converter(32.)
4150 with pytest.raises(TypeError,
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4151 match="'float' object cannot be interpreted as an integer"):
4152 converter([32.])
4153 with pytest.raises(ValueError,
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4154 match="Maximum allowed dimension"):
4155 # These converters currently convert overflows to a ValueError
4156 converter(2**64)
4157

4159 class TestSubscripting:
4160 def test_test_zero_rank(self):
4161 x = np.array([1, 2, 3])
4162 assert_(isinstance(x[0], np.int_))
4163 assert_(type(x[0, ...]) is np.ndarray)

4166 class TestPickling:
4167 @pytest.mark.skipif(pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL >= 5,
4168 reason=('this tests the error messages when trying to'
4169 'protocol 5 although it is not available'))
4170 def test_correct_protocol5_error_message(self):
  • F841 Local variable 'array' is assigned to but never used
4171 array = np.arange(10)
4172  
4173 def test_record_array_with_object_dtype(self):
4174 my_object = object()
4175  
4176 arr_with_object = np.array(
4177 [(my_object, 1, 2.0)],
4178 dtype=[('a', object), ('b', int), ('c', float)])
4179 arr_without_object = np.array(
4180 [('xxx', 1, 2.0)],
4181 dtype=[('a', str), ('b', int), ('c', float)])
4182  
4183 for proto in range(2, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL + 1):
4184 depickled_arr_with_object = pickle.loads(
4185 pickle.dumps(arr_with_object, protocol=proto))
4186 depickled_arr_without_object = pickle.loads(
4187 pickle.dumps(arr_without_object, protocol=proto))
4188  
4189 assert_equal(arr_with_object.dtype,
4190 depickled_arr_with_object.dtype)
4191 assert_equal(arr_without_object.dtype,
4192 depickled_arr_without_object.dtype)
4193  
4194 @pytest.mark.skipif(pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL < 5,
4195 reason="requires pickle protocol 5")
4196 def test_f_contiguous_array(self):
4197 f_contiguous_array = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]], order='F')
4198 buffers = []
4199  
4200 # When using pickle protocol 5, Fortran-contiguous arrays can be
4201 # serialized using out-of-band buffers
4202 bytes_string = pickle.dumps(f_contiguous_array, protocol=5,
4203 buffer_callback=buffers.append)
4204  
4205 assert len(buffers) > 0
4206  
4207 depickled_f_contiguous_array = pickle.loads(bytes_string,
4208 buffers=buffers)
4209  
4210 assert_equal(f_contiguous_array, depickled_f_contiguous_array)
4211  
4212 def test_non_contiguous_array(self):
4213 non_contiguous_array = np.arange(12).reshape(3, 4)[:, :2]
4214 assert not non_contiguous_array.flags.c_contiguous
4215 assert not non_contiguous_array.flags.f_contiguous
4216  
4217 # make sure non-contiguous arrays can be pickled-depickled
4218 # using any protocol
4219 for proto in range(2, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL + 1):
4220 depickled_non_contiguous_array = pickle.loads(
4221 pickle.dumps(non_contiguous_array, protocol=proto))
4222  
4223 assert_equal(non_contiguous_array, depickled_non_contiguous_array)
4224  
4225 def test_roundtrip(self):
4226 for proto in range(2, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL + 1):
4227 carray = np.array([[2, 9], [7, 0], [3, 8]])
4228 DATA = [
4229 carray,
4230 np.transpose(carray),
4231 np.array([('xxx', 1, 2.0)], dtype=[('a', (str, 3)), ('b', int),
4232 ('c', float)])
4233 ]
4234  
4235 refs = [weakref.ref(a) for a in DATA]
4236 for a in DATA:
4237 assert_equal(
4238 a, pickle.loads(pickle.dumps(a, protocol=proto)),
4239 err_msg="%r" % a)
4240 del a, DATA, carray
4241 break_cycles()
4242 # check for reference leaks (gh-12793)
4243 for ref in refs:
4244 assert ref() is None
4245  
4246 def _loads(self, obj):
4247 return pickle.loads(obj, encoding='latin1')
4248

4294 def test_datetime64_byteorder(self):
4295 original = np.array([['2015-02-24T00:00:00.000000000']], dtype='datetime64[ns]')
4296  
4297 original_byte_reversed = original.copy(order='K')
4298 original_byte_reversed.dtype = original_byte_reversed.dtype.newbyteorder('S')
4299 original_byte_reversed.byteswap(inplace=True)
4300  
4301 new = pickle.loads(pickle.dumps(original_byte_reversed))
4302  
4303 assert_equal(original.dtype, new.dtype)
4304

4306 class TestFancyIndexing:
4307 def test_list(self):
4308 x = np.ones((1, 1))
4309 x[:, [0]] = 2.0
4310 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[2.0]]))
4311  
4312 x = np.ones((1, 1, 1))
4313 x[:, :, [0]] = 2.0
4314 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[[2.0]]]))
4315  
4316 def test_tuple(self):

4318 x[:, (0,)] = 2.0
4319 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[2.0]]))
4320 x = np.ones((1, 1, 1))
4321 x[:, :, (0,)] = 2.0
4322 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[[2.0]]]))

4324 def test_mask(self):
4325 x = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
4326 m = np.array([0, 1, 0, 0], bool)
4327 assert_array_equal(x[m], np.array([2]))
4328  
4329 def test_mask2(self):
4330 x = np.array([[1, 2, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7, 8]])
4331 m = np.array([0, 1], bool)
4332 m2 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [1, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4333 m3 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4334 assert_array_equal(x[m], np.array([[5, 6, 7, 8]]))
4335 assert_array_equal(x[m2], np.array([2, 5]))
4336 assert_array_equal(x[m3], np.array([2]))
4337  
4338 def test_assign_mask(self):
4339 x = np.array([1, 2, 3, 4])
4340 m = np.array([0, 1, 0, 0], bool)
4341 x[m] = 5
4342 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([1, 5, 3, 4]))
4343  
4344 def test_assign_mask2(self):
4345 xorig = np.array([[1, 2, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7, 8]])
4346 m = np.array([0, 1], bool)
4347 m2 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [1, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4348 m3 = np.array([[0, 1, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0, 0]], bool)
4349 x = xorig.copy()
4350 x[m] = 10
4351 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[1, 2, 3, 4], [10, 10, 10, 10]]))
4352 x = xorig.copy()
4353 x[m2] = 10
4354 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[1, 10, 3, 4], [10, 6, 7, 8]]))
4355 x = xorig.copy()
4356 x[m3] = 10
4357 assert_array_equal(x, np.array([[1, 10, 3, 4], [5, 6, 7, 8]]))
4358

4360 class TestStringCompare:
4361 def test_string(self):
4362 g1 = np.array(["This", "is", "example"])
4363 g2 = np.array(["This", "was", "example"])
4364 assert_array_equal(g1 == g2, [g1[i] == g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4365 assert_array_equal(g1 != g2, [g1[i] != g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4366 assert_array_equal(g1 <= g2, [g1[i] <= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4367 assert_array_equal(g1 >= g2, [g1[i] >= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4368 assert_array_equal(g1 < g2, [g1[i] < g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4369 assert_array_equal(g1 > g2, [g1[i] > g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4370  
4371 def test_mixed(self):
4372 g1 = np.array(["spam", "spa", "spammer", "and eggs"])
4373 g2 = "spam"
4374 assert_array_equal(g1 == g2, [x == g2 for x in g1])
4375 assert_array_equal(g1 != g2, [x != g2 for x in g1])
4376 assert_array_equal(g1 < g2, [x < g2 for x in g1])
4377 assert_array_equal(g1 > g2, [x > g2 for x in g1])
4378 assert_array_equal(g1 <= g2, [x <= g2 for x in g1])
4379 assert_array_equal(g1 >= g2, [x >= g2 for x in g1])
4380  
4381 def test_unicode(self):
4382 g1 = np.array([u"This", u"is", u"example"])
4383 g2 = np.array([u"This", u"was", u"example"])
4384 assert_array_equal(g1 == g2, [g1[i] == g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4385 assert_array_equal(g1 != g2, [g1[i] != g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4386 assert_array_equal(g1 <= g2, [g1[i] <= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4387 assert_array_equal(g1 >= g2, [g1[i] >= g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4388 assert_array_equal(g1 < g2, [g1[i] < g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4389 assert_array_equal(g1 > g2, [g1[i] > g2[i] for i in [0, 1, 2]])
4390  
  • E302 Expected 2 blank lines, found 1

4402 @pytest.mark.parametrize('method', [np.argmax, np.argmin])
4403 def test_np_argmin_argmax_keepdims(self, size, axis, method):
4404  
4405 arr = np.random.normal(size=size)
4406  
4407 # contiguous arrays
4408 if axis is None:
4409 new_shape = [1 for _ in range(len(size))]
4410 else:
4411 new_shape = list(size)
4412 new_shape[axis] = 1
4413 new_shape = tuple(new_shape)
4414  
4415 _res_orig = method(arr, axis=axis)
4416 res_orig = _res_orig.reshape(new_shape)
4417 res = method(arr, axis=axis, keepdims=True)
4418 assert_equal(res, res_orig)
4419 assert_(res.shape == new_shape)
4420 outarray = np.empty(res.shape, dtype=res.dtype)
4421 res1 = method(arr, axis=axis, out=outarray,
  • E127 Continuation line over-indented for visual indent
4422 keepdims=True)
4423 assert_(res1 is outarray)
4424 assert_equal(res, outarray)
4425  
4426 if len(size) > 0:
4427 wrong_shape = list(new_shape)
4428 if axis is not None:
4429 wrong_shape[axis] = 2
4430 else:
4431 wrong_shape[0] = 2
4432 wrong_outarray = np.empty(wrong_shape, dtype=res.dtype)
4433 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
4434 method(arr.T, axis=axis,
  • E127 Continuation line over-indented for visual indent
4435 out=wrong_outarray, keepdims=True)
4436  
4437 # non-contiguous arrays
4438 if axis is None:
4439 new_shape = [1 for _ in range(len(size))]
4440 else:
4441 new_shape = list(size)[::-1]
4442 new_shape[axis] = 1
4443 new_shape = tuple(new_shape)
4444  
4445 _res_orig = method(arr.T, axis=axis)
4446 res_orig = _res_orig.reshape(new_shape)
4447 res = method(arr.T, axis=axis, keepdims=True)
4448 assert_equal(res, res_orig)
4449 assert_(res.shape == new_shape)
4450 outarray = np.empty(new_shape[::-1], dtype=res.dtype)
4451 outarray = outarray.T
4452 res1 = method(arr.T, axis=axis, out=outarray,
  • E127 Continuation line over-indented for visual indent
4453 keepdims=True)
4454 assert_(res1 is outarray)
4455 assert_equal(res, outarray)
4456  
4457 if len(size) > 0:
4458 # one dimension lesser for non-zero sized
4459 # array should raise an error
4460 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
4461 method(arr[0], axis=axis,
  • E127 Continuation line over-indented for visual indent
4462 out=outarray, keepdims=True)
4463  
4464 if len(size) > 0:
4465 wrong_shape = list(new_shape)
4466 if axis is not None:
4467 wrong_shape[axis] = 2
4468 else:
4469 wrong_shape[0] = 2
4470 wrong_outarray = np.empty(wrong_shape, dtype=res.dtype)
4471 with pytest.raises(ValueError):
4472 method(arr.T, axis=axis,
  • E127 Continuation line over-indented for visual indent
4473 out=wrong_outarray, keepdims=True)

4475 @pytest.mark.parametrize('method', ['max', 'min'])
4476 def test_all(self, method):
4477 a = np.random.normal(0, 1, (4, 5, 6, 7, 8))
4478 arg_method = getattr(a, 'arg' + method)
4479 val_method = getattr(a, method)
4480 for i in range(a.ndim):
4481 a_maxmin = val_method(i)
4482 aarg_maxmin = arg_method(i)
4483 axes = list(range(a.ndim))
4484 axes.remove(i)
4485 assert_(np.all(a_maxmin == aarg_maxmin.choose(
4486 *a.transpose(i, *axes))))
4487  
4488 @pytest.mark.parametrize('method', ['argmax', 'argmin'])
4489 def test_output_shape(self, method):
4490 # see also gh-616
4491 a = np.ones((10, 5))
4492 arg_method = getattr(a, method)
4493 # Check some simple shape mismatches
4494 out = np.ones(11, dtype=np.int_)
4495 assert_raises(ValueError, arg_method, -1, out)
4496  
4497 out = np.ones((2, 5), dtype=np.int_)
4498 assert_raises(ValueError, arg_method, -1, out)
4499  
4500 # these could be relaxed possibly (used to allow even the previous)
4501 out = np.ones((1, 10), dtype=np.int_)
4502 assert_raises(ValueError, arg_method, -1, out)
4503  
4504 out = np.ones(10, dtype=np.int_)
4505 arg_method(-1, out=out)
4506 assert_equal(out, arg_method(-1))
4507  
4508 @pytest.mark.parametrize('ndim', [0, 1])
4509 @pytest.mark.parametrize('method', ['argmax', 'argmin'])
4510 def test_ret_is_out(self, ndim, method):
4511 a = np.ones((4,) + (256,)*ndim)
4512 arg_method = getattr(a, method)
4513 out = np.empty((256,)*ndim, dtype=np.intp)
4514 ret = arg_method(axis=0, out=out)
4515 assert ret is out
4516  
4517 @pytest.mark.parametrize('np_array, method, idx, val',
  • E128 Continuation line under-indented for visual indent
4518 [(np.zeros, 'argmax', 5942, "as"),
4519 (np.ones, 'argmin', 6001, "0")])
4520 def test_unicode(self, np_array, method, idx, val):
4521 d = np_array(6031, dtype='<U9')
4522 arg_method = getattr(d, method)
4523 d[idx] = val
